OOC: There's just one active Rogue in the base - and she's a doozy.

Gatara::

The control room has a single occupant, and that occupant requires 
little introduction.  Gatara turns, her massive, quasi-reptilian form 
looming over everything here.

"Hello, Noir," she says.  "Welcome back to the land of the living."

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> -- Noir --
> 
> Noir steps out of the now useless stasis chamber's chair. Her 
joints 
> were a little unused from the long period of unawareness, but she 
> ignored that problem. Use would wear them in.
> 
> <Noir.> The word, or perhaps name, still remains part of her 
passive 
> thoughts, sitting in the back of her mind like an unmistakeable 
> signature of her passing. "Noir." Her soft cold voice says quietly 
> to nobody in particular as she excercises her joints momentarily to 
> ensure their ability to function.
> 
> Her hands absent mindedly slide into specific locations, her right 
> had on her right hip, and her left had behind her back. Pistols pop 
> out of hidden slots, and she fingers them gingerly, looking them 
> over slowly before putting them back.
> 
> Her eyes scan the room, and rest on a mid sized table which has a 
> electronic device sitting on it in the middle of the room. 
> Cautiously, she walks over to the table, but before she can 
> touch the device, an interactive hologram flickered into existance 
> above it. 
> 
> "Noir." The image said. "Welcome to the Rogues base of the moment."
> 
> Noir eyes the holo warily, "... Keep talking." The image then 
> strikes her memmory, and she seems to remmeber this figure... 
> Devilcat, the Rogue leader.
> 
> "You are to contact the active rogues immediately for your current 
> orders. And try not to delay." The image finished.
> 
> <Shoulda had something more... important to say... oh well> She 
> checks to see that she has everything, then quietly leaves the 
room. 
> Her memory showed her where everything was located. It seemed that 
> she'd been here before for a long time, and knew it like the back 
of 
> her hand. Knowing this, she made the trip to the control room as 
> quick as possible.
> 
> Unafraid of running into any other bots, she walks right into the 
> control and communications room, her eyes scanning the room right 
> from the instant she had entered.
> 
> (is there anyone in the Rogue base? or is Noir going to have to 
> contact the others.)
